Package uk.co.spudsoft.dircache

Interface DirCache

All Superinterfaces:
AutoCloseable
All Known Implementing Classes:
DirCacheImpl
public interface DirCache extends AutoCloseable
A self-updating cache of the structure of files in a directory on disc.
Author:
jtalbut

  • Method Details

    • close

      void close()
      Override of AutoCloseable.close() to specify that is does not throw. Close the DirCache, freeing up resources and preventing any future use of it.
      Specified by:
      close in interface AutoCloseable

    • cache

      static DirCache cache(Path root, Duration stabilizationgLag, Pattern ignore) throws FileNotFoundException, IOException
      Create a dir cache of a given path, monitoring for any changes that occur. Note that all the Nodes of a DirCache are immutable, whenever a change occurs the cache is rebuilt from the root. As with most caches, the cache must be read more than written to make sense.
      Parameters:
      root - The root of the directory cache, which should be a directory.
      stabilizationgLag - Time to wait after a file has changed before notifying the caller. Note that the file structure is picked up by the DirCache immediately, it is only the callbacks that are delayed.
      ignore - Regular expression of files to ignore.
      Returns:
      a newly created DirCache instance.
      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException - if the root Path cannot be found, or if it is not a directory.
      IOException - if attempts to walk the directory tree fail.

    • getRoot

      DirCacheTree.Directory getRoot()
      Return the Directory at the root of the tree. This will be the Directory object representing the original root Path.
      Returns:
      the Directory at the root of the tree.

    • start

      DirCache start() throws IOException
      Start the DirCache monitoring. This does not usually need to be called as the factory method does it.
      Returns:
      this, so that the call may be fluent.
      Throws:
      IOException - if the watch service cannot be started.

    • stop

      DirCache stop()
      Stop the DirCache monitoring. It is permitted to stop and restart the cache , this will inherently refresh the view of the filesystem so do not call refresh after restarting.
      Returns:
      this, so that the call may be fluent.

    • setCallback

      DirCache setCallback(Runnable callback)
      Set the callback to be called after each (stable) directory change. The callback is optional, clients can simply depend upon the cached structure. The primary use of the callback is expected to be the invalidation of secondary caches (of processed files).
      Parameters:
      callback - the callback to be called after each (stable) directory change.
      Returns:
      this, so that the call may be fluent.

    • getLastWalkTime

      LocalDateTime getLastWalkTime()
      Get the timestamp of the last file walk.
      Returns:
      the timestamp of the last file walk.

    • refresh

      void refresh()
      Perform a synchronous refresh of the view of the filesystem. This should be used sparingly, it's intended for use when a client has made a specific change the filesystem that we know needs to be picked up.
